name: 'Grand' Geography Names Quiz | Names, Maps and Borders | 10 Questions

questions.text: Two U.S. national parks have the word 'Grand' in their names.  In which two states are these national parks located?
questions.explanation:
Wyoming and Arizona.

	The two parks in question are Grand Canyon National Park, Arizona and Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming.  Year after year, the Grand Canyon is the second most visited national park in the United States, after Great Smokey Mountain National Park.  It is located in the northern portion of Arizona.  Grand Teton National Park is located just south of Yellowstone National Park in northwest Wyoming.  It contains some of the most beautiful mountain peaks in the world.

questions.text: The Bahamas, located just off the southeast coast of Florida, is a country made up of 700 islands and keys.  Is it true that the largest island in The Bahamas is called Grand Bahama Island?
questions.explanation:
No.

	In actuality, the largest Bahamian island is called Andros Island at 2300 sq. miles in total size.  Grand Bahama Island is the fourth largest island of The Bahamas (at 430 total sq. miles), after Andros, Abaco and Great Inagua.

questions.text: The Gran Chaco of South America may best be described as which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Lowland plain.

	The Gran Chaco is a 250,000 square mile expanse, largely in northern Argentina and Paraguay, and extending into Bolivia.  Most of the Gran Chaco is nonagricultural, and is dotted with forests and swamps, some of which have not been fully explored.

questions.text: The Rio Grande is a great river that makes up a substantial portion of the U.S./Mexico border.  In which U.S. state does the Rio Grande rise?
questions.explanation:
Colorado.

	The Rio Grande is the fifth longest river in North America, and 20th longest in the world.  It rises in San Juan Country, Colorado, fittingly amid the Rio Grande National Forest.  The river is called the Río Bravo in Mexico.

questions.text: The United States is not the only one with 'grand' national parks.  In which country can you find Cape Le Grand National Park?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	Cape Le Grand National Park is 631 km east of Perth, Australia, on the southern coast.  It was named for a French officer aboard a ship exploring the region in the late 18th century.  Cape Le Grand National Park is known for its beautiful beaches and inland mountains and hills.

questions.text: This tiny set of three islands includes the names 'Grand', 'Little' and 'Brac'.  To which island group am I referring?
questions.explanation:
Cayman.

	The Cayman Islands consist of Grand Cayman, Cayman Brac and Little Cayman, in order of size.  They are a British dependency, and are located south of Cuba and west of Jamaica.  According to the CIA factbook, the total area of the Cayman Islands does not exceed 1.5 times that of Washington, DC.

questions.text: Which set of these Iberian-controlled archipelagos has an island with 'Gran' in its name?
questions.explanation:
Canary Islands.

	One of the largest of the Las Palmas (of the Canary Islands) is called Gran Canaria.  The Canary Islands are located off the coast of Morocco and are controlled by Spain.

questions.text: In which country can you find the Grand Canal, a 1,000 mile long manmade waterway that was started in the 6th century A.D.?
questions.explanation:
China.

	The Grand Canal, aka Da Yunhe, is approximately 1,000 miles long, extending from Beijing in the north to the city of Hangzhou in the south.  Another famous Grand Canal can be found in Venice; it is the primary travelway in the Italian city.

questions.text: Which U.S. president signed into existence the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument, found in southern Utah?
questions.explanation:
Clinton.

	The Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument covers 1.7 million acres of beautiful wilderness in southern Utah.  It was the largest national monument in the lower 48 U.S. states to be created in the 20th century.

questions.text: While the Rio Grande can be found between the U.S. and Mexico, it is not the only river with that name.  In which of these countries can be found another Rio Grande?
questions.explanation:
Bolivia.

	The Grande River can be found entirely in Bolivia.  It is a tributary of the Mamoré, which in turn is a tributary of the Madeira, which in turn empties into the Amazon River.  Thank you for having tried this quiz, I hope you enjoyed it and will attempt some of my other quizzes on this website.
